thread.title: Met Office issues amber warning for the Anglia region as Storm Doris sweeps in | Anglia - ITV News
thread.title_full: Met Office issues amber warning for the Anglia region as Storm Doris sweeps in | Anglia - ITV News

title: Met Office issues amber warning for the Anglia region as Storm Doris sweeps in | Anglia - ITV News
text:
21 February 2017 at 10:43am Met Office issues amber warning for the Anglia region as Storm Doris sweeps in The Met Office is warning of storm weather in the Anglia region on Thursday. Credit: Gareth Fuller/PA Wire/PA Images 
The Met Office has issued an early amber storm warning for strong winds forecast to hit the Anglia region on Thursday as Storm Doris sweeps in from the Atlantic. 
Winds could gust up to 80 mph with the risk of trees coming down and disruption to travel. 
The Met Office says: "Whilst the strongest winds look to be only short-lived, damage to structures, interruptions to power supplies and widespread disruption to travel networks are likely, with a danger of injury from flying debris." 
The animation below shows the forecast track of Storm Doris on Thursday which the strongest winds where the isobar lines are closest together Play video 
The Met Office says some very strong winds are expected throughout Thursday in association with storm 'Doris', with a short period where gusts of 70 to 80 mph are possible. 
Heavy rain is also likely through Thursday as well as some snow over high ground as the system clears eastwards. These may prove additional hazards. 
The Amber warning means "be prepared" and is in place for northern parts of Norfolk and Cambridgeshire. The lower level "be aware" yellow warning has been issued for most of the rest of the Anglia region. 
The strong wind warning is in force from 6am until 6pm on Thursday 23 February 2017 Areas covered by yellow and amber weather warnings for strong winds on Thursday. Credit: Met Office 
"A developing area of low pressure is expected to move across the UK on Thursday. 
"The exact timing and track of this system remain uncertain but there is potential for a short-lived core of very strong winds to develop. 
"Whilst some disruption is expected outside of this stronger swathe of winds, the amber area looks most likely to see more significant disruption." â€“ Met Office Chief Forecaster's assessment Winds could gust up to 80mph in the north of the Anglia region on Thursday. Credit: Met Office 
The video animation below shows the areas at risk of gale force winds marked in yellow and orange A deep area of low pressure is set to sweep across the Anglia region on Thursday. Credit: ITV Weather
